Case reference: 2013000033.CaseDesc: Bernard Deromer was last seen at the metro station Berri UQAM on June 5, 1982. He is blind and walks with a white cane. He may have been approached by a religious sect.

Teeth: Other, upper front tooth obliquely broken
Other: blind and walks with a white cane
Scar: Right Ear, near the right ear

Case reference: 2014005292.CaseDesc: On December 4, 1992, at approximately 6:30am, Renata Ejsmont was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The day before her disappearance, Renata had quit her job and told her former employer that she was moving back to Poland.

Case reference: 2014004464.CaseDesc: Singh Sukmwinder Lebahna was last seen in Montreal on February 26, 2004. He left the apartment he was sharing with a friend, taking all his personal belongings, stating he wanted to live in Vancouver. Singh is originally from India.

Case reference: 2016068405.CaseDesc: On March 29, 1970, the remains of a male were found on the Lake Erie shore in Point Pelee National Park. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated that he had been in the water for approximately 1 week to 6 months prior to discovery.

Case reference: 2014004850.CaseDesc: On November 26, 2006, Mario Julien was seen for the last time when he left his home aboard a taxi. The taxi transported him just to the roundabout in the Québec Bridge, in Quebec City, Quebec.

Case reference: 2022060312.CaseDesc: On October 28, 2022, Bradley McGilvery was seen for the last time at a family residence in Saddle Lake,  St. Paul, Alberta.

Case reference: 2023005753.CaseDesc: On January 1,1970, Anne Moran was last seen by her husband in their residence in Toronto, Ontario.  It was believed by her family that her husband reported her missing however no report can be located.  Her husband has since passed away.

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2018008636.CaseDesc: On February 6, 2018, at approximately 11:30pm, Guerman Pouchkine was last seen in the area of Steels Avenue West and Keele Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2009004799.CaseDesc: Neil McDougall left Three-Way Demolition in Durham on Friday, October 11, 1985 with a co-worker and went home. He had an argument with his wife and the friend left. After supper Mr. McDougall went to Ayton, to the Commercial Hotel. He left the hotel with someone else and they met up elsewhere with the co-worker.  Mr. McDougall returned to the hotel and left at closing time, between 1:30 – 1:40 am. He was last reported leaving a residence on Edmund Street, Ayton at 2 a.m. October 12, 1985. His pickup truck was discovered near Ayton later that day. The ashtray was filled with different brands of cigarette butts. He has been described as meticulous, habitual, responsible and hardworking. When he went missing, Neil was planning to adopt his wife's children. Foul play is suspected. Mr. McDougall was declared legally dead in 1996.

Jacket: Blue, Work style with name on it

Case reference: 2018063233.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1994, at approximately 10:00pm, Stanislawa ‘Mary’ Jurkiewicz last spoke with her family. It is believed that the following morning, Mary left her residence in the area of Fern Avenue and Roncesvalles Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020007369.CaseDesc: On October 14, 1981, at approximately 9:00pm, May Mah was last seen by her nurse in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016030725.CaseDesc: Bryan Twan was reported missing in Quesnel, British Columbia, on June 7, 2016.  Bryan was last seen near Quesnel's West Park Mall and has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Denim, Light Blue, Yellow Drilling Rig Logo
Tattoo: Right Arm, BEV Heart and Unicorn

Case reference: 2007004899.CaseDesc: James Gordon MacDonald was last seen by his father on October 23, 1980 in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario. An extensive investigation by the Sault Ste Marie Police Service was conducted but to this date James has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001849.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1974, Murphy Williams was last seen working in a labour camp located between Fort St. John and Dawson Creek in British Columbia. It was reported that Mr. Williams was exhibiting signs of distress and it is believed that he may have attempted to walk from the labour camp to Fort St. John.

Case reference: 2014004699.CaseDesc: On October 4, 2005, Veeravi Jeya Eskimuttu "VJ", was last seen leaving his place of employment in Saint John, NB. He is known to be transient and has lived in Toronto, Cornwall, Montreal and Halifax.

Case reference: 2021043326.CaseDesc: In the evening of September 20, 2021, Jeremiah Guthro was seen for the last time as he walked away from his residence in the Glebe neighbourhood in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2009005099.CaseDesc: Russell Hoffert was a voluntary patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital, Highway 11 North, in North Bay, Ontario. Mr. Hoffert walked away from the hospital grounds, in poor winter like weather and was not properly dressed for the conditions. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004252.CaseDesc: Gordie Dixon was reported missing by his family on 19 March 1990 in Eden Valley, Alberta.  Gordie may have been seen on the Macleod Trail in Calgary, Alberta a few months before he was reported missing.

Case reference: 2014005815.CaseDesc: On June 18, 2012 at 1630 hours, Regina Police Service received a phone call from Floyd Kakakaway reporting his brother Frederick Kakakaway missing. Floyd advised that the last time he saw Fred was early in the morning on the 14th of June, 2012 at 0600 hours. Fred told Floyd that he was headed to the Regent Park Safeway to look for cans. He hasn't returned home and no one has seen him since. Fred is a diabetic.

Deformity: Right Leg, Walks with a slight limp
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, A cross, forks and a heart
Left Upper Arm, Heart and ribbon with Fred

Case reference: 2006022899.CaseDesc: Eric  Schoenleber was last seen while fishing in a canoe on Innes Lake on May 16, 1972.

Case reference: 2013000094.CaseDesc: Robert Beauchamp was last seen in Montreal on June 22, 1993. He left his home with friends and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2018056491.CaseDesc: On March 10, 1994, at approximately 6:15pm, Gallus Huber was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Gallus was scheduled to attend a language class but did not show up.

Case reference: 2014004206.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1988, 3 people were visiting Leonard Kalichak at his residence and had decided to go out in a boat on Lake Dauphin, Manitoba. When they left shore they were faced with adverse conditions subsequently capsizing the boat. At this point, Mr. Kalichak immediately went under the water, possibly as a result of heavy clothing or an injury sustained when the boat capsized. Searches were conducted by land, air, water and dragging operations on the lake. Leonard Kalichak has never been found and he is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014005450.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1979 James Gordon Nevin departed from his residence in Amherstburg, Ontario heading west for a 2 week vacation with the intention of visiting relatives. Mr. Nevin had a grandson in Winnipeg, Manitoba and a son in Prince George, British Columbia. Neither relative had prior notification Mr. Nevin's intentions to visit.   On June 14, 1979 the RCMP responded to a call and James Nevin's vehicle, a 1974 white/maroon Dodge Coronet, was located in a ditch between Rocanville, Saskatchewan and St. Lazare, Manitoba. Inquiries reveal the vehicle was at this location since June 8, 1979.   Mr. Nevin has never been seen again and likely went missing between 1:30 pm and 3:00 pm on June 8, 1979. Extensive searches were conducted by land and air all with negative results. James Gordon Nevin was never seen again. Foul play cannot be ruled out.

Scar: Right Thumb, Skin graft scar on right or left thumb

Case reference: 2020010648.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1992, at approximately 9:00pm, Harry White was seen for the last time as he left his father’s residence in Toronto, Ontario. Harry’s boat was later found in Bluffer’s Park with the engine still running.

Case reference: 2014004091.CaseDesc: Mark Gibbons was seen for the last time on February 1, 1991 at his home in Calgary, Alberta.  He was reported missing by his family and Mark has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2011001499.CaseDesc: At the time of his disappearance, Luke Joly-Durocher was visiting friends in North Bay, Ontario. He resides in Temiskaming, Quebec. Video surveillance showed Luke being refused entry into Cecil's Eatery and Beer Society at approximately 11:54 p.m. He left by himself and has not been seen or heard from since that time.

Belt: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Studded belt, black on the front and purple around the waist
Shirt: Grey, T-shirt, may have had a small purple animal logo on the bottom corner
Deformity: Right Forearm, Thinner than left forearm

Case reference: 2014004667.CaseDesc: The Gypsumville RCMP detachment received a report that an aircraft was in distress over Lake Winnipeg near Reindeer Island. The aircraft, a single engine Cherokee 140, had three people on board; the pilot and two passengers. The pilot had indicated that the engine had seized and that he was trying to make it to Reindeer Island. He then stated that he was going down in to the water. Two RCMP Twin Otters and an Air Search and Rescue Hercules conducted a search by air. It was not possible to search the lake by boat as there was too much ice on the lake. All three are presumed dead due to drowning or from the impact of the crash.

Case reference: 2013000100.CaseDesc: On 25 August 1969, Murdo Baker left his camp to tend to his fishing nets in South Indian Lake, Manitoba. By 28 August he had not returned and the police were notified. His boat was recovered by police but his remains were never found. Murdo is presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Right Leg, Several scars below knee

Case reference: 2014004895.CaseDesc: Desmond Peter's grandmother saw him for the last time on March 6, 2007, she reported him missing a few days later. Desmond was not happy with his home life and would often leave the house for days, but he would always return.  During the first year of his disappearance there were several unconfirmed sightings of Desmond, however none of them were considered reliable enough to confirm his whereabouts.  All tips and information brought to the investigators continues to be followed up on.

Case reference: 2014004569.CaseDesc: In August 1966, Philomene (Tiger) Lemay was socializing at a local bar in Slave Lake.  She was last seen very intoxicated.  Mrs. Lemay may have left with one or two men, possibly Americans, in the early evening.

Case reference: 2020038049.CaseDesc: On March 27, 2020, Joshua Reiner was reported missing to New York Police, in the United States. Joshua’s vehicle was located in Niagara Falls, New York. A male was later observed on surveillance cameras climbing over a railing and walking towards the brink of the falls. The male was later confirmed to be Joshua Reiner by family members. It is suspected that he jumped into the falls and did not resurface.

Case reference: 2015066565.CaseDesc: George Wood was last seen in Surrey BC, on June 20, 2015 by family. At the time George Wood was reported missing, he was unemployed and of no fixed address living on the streets in Burnaby BC. His absence and not keeping in touch with family is out of character.

Belt: Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Black belt with large silver buckle
Scar: Right Arm, Long scar on right arm

Case reference: 2014005316.CaseDesc: On March 31, 2002, Jenifer Morse was seen for the last time when she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2023045401.CaseDesc: Dany Côté has been missing from the municipality of Rivière-Bleue, Québec since August 17, 2023.  It is unusual for Dany to go for extended lengths of time without communicating with his family or friends. Due to medical conditions, Dany has difficulty walking and rarely leaves his apartment. He performs errands in the immediate area of his home which happens to be near a river that flows into the waters of the State of Maine, USA.

Jacket: Blue, Grey, Blue and grey winter jacket
Pants: Black, Black sport pants with a white line
Amputation: Left Little Finger, Left little finger is amputated
Scar: Right Hand, Scar on the right hand
Left Hand, Scar on the left hand

Case reference: 2014003406.CaseDesc: Anthony Janvier was last seen at the courthouse in Cold Lake, Alberta on April 8, 1998. He was reported missing by his mother on February 7, 2002. Anthony lived a transient lifestyle which accounts for the 4 year delay in reporting him missing.

Case reference: 2018067897.CaseDesc: Robert Lambert, an American citizen who moved to Canada in 2004, was reported missing on November 30th, 2018 in Montague Township in Ontario.  Robert experienced mobility issues and signs of dementia and foul play cannot be ruled out at this time.

Case reference: 2006024499.CaseDesc: Allan MacKenzie was last seen in Chapleau, Ontario on November 5, 1987. He was making a delivery with his red and green tractor/trailer to the Ministry of Natural Resources in Chapleau and then believed to be enroute to Toronto, Ontario. He was subsequently reported overdue in Toronto and has not been seen since. His trailer and tractor were located, parked north of Sultan, ON.

Case reference: 2006007399.CaseDesc: On January 5, 1991 Bruce Blimkie left the Riverview Inn in Norway Bay, Quebec, to travel home by snowmobile, across the Ottawa River, to Arnprior, Ontario.  It is believed that Mr. Blimkie was travelling in an area of the Ottawa River where there was open water, and that his snowmobile went through the ice into the water. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014001408.CaseDesc: On September 13th, 1997, two fishermen failed to show up at their final destination and as a result they were reported missing to police. An immediate search of the lake was conducted and one of the men was found alive on a island. HUNTER was never found.

Case reference: 2014033444.CaseDesc: On the evening of May 2, 1979, Michel Pelletier, and his older sister, were seen for the last time playing in their relatives’ backyard in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. On July 13, 1979, the body of Michel’s sister was found in the St-Lawrence River, however he has not been found.

Case reference: 2014006246.CaseDesc: On March 30, 1991, Jason O'Donaghey's roommate reported him missing as he had not been seen for 3 days. There were rumours that Jason left North Vancouver voluntarily, but his whereabouts are still unknown. He was a talented artist who may be making a living by selling aboriginal carvings.

Hair: Black, Long, Short on top, long at bottom
Shirt: Cotton, White, Dress shirt with longsleeve

Case reference: 2015059939.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1973, the remains of a male were recovered from the water near the Fleet Street Pumping Station, Ottawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 170-180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  It is estimated that he had been in the water between 2 and 3 months.

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2014001530.CaseDesc: Ronald Nodeland was last seen by his family on August 20, 1978, at his residence in Edson, Alberta. His motorcycle and helmet were found approximately one month later in a remote region southwest of Sundre, Alberta. Ronald may have been observed on foot in the vicinity shortly afterward, however he was never located.

Case reference: 2016059696.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2016, at approximately 1:00 a.m., Michelle Byron was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Other, WINTER, Dark coloured winter coat

Case reference: 2012003499.CaseDesc: On January 24, 1983, Tim Maletic left his family residence in Kitchener, Ontario. He left a note saying he was going to Toronto and has not been heard from since. Mr. Maletic also has ties to the Windsor, Ontario area.

Backpack: Blue, Red, Adidas, Blue with red trim

Case reference: 2012020147.CaseDesc: On March 25, 1996, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Upper Levels Highway in West Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had recovered from severe injuries to his right arm and leg. He also had a fractured skull, nose and ribs. These injuries were likely a result of a single major accident. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Corduroy, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 3/4 length coat with fleece
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Side Of Head, Recent fracture to the left temporal bone above the left ear
Nose, Old nasal fracture with visible deformity
Deformity: Shoulders, Old injury; no indication of which shoulder

Case reference: 2014005549.CaseDesc: At the end of September, 2010, Dustin McMillan left Edmonton to drive to Ontario. Police have not been able to confirm where and when Dustin was last seen but he never made it to his final destination.

Case reference: 1994001630.CaseDesc: On November 26, 1988, Amber Potts was seen for the last time in Etobicoke, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Amber was staying in a hotel room and was living a high-risk lifestyle. All her personal belongings were left in her hotel room.

Case reference: 2014006218.CaseDesc: Lori Kasprick, who sometimes went by "Lovey", was last seen in the mid-1970s.  She was from Hilliard and going to school in Mundare when last seen.  Lori may have had ties to Tofield and Ryley.  Her grandparents lived in Holden at that time, and Lori could have made acquaintance with others her age when going to visit.

Case reference: 2015018154.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1966, Delores Whiteman was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2022019657.CaseDesc: On January 9, 1989, Richard Figura was seen for the last time near the brink of the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, Richard was despondent.

Case reference: 2014004725.CaseDesc: Jack Ford was last seen on September 20, 1991. His abandoned vehicle was located by hunters on a cut line near Cold Lake on September 21 or 28 of 1991. Mr. Ford was reported missing October 16, 1991 by his son.

Case reference: 2014003365.CaseDesc: At approximately 2:00 p.m. on October 30, 1982, Daniel Christensen left the family cabin in the area of Long Lake, Manitoba. He left with the family dog and his intention was to go chicken hunting. His family reported him missing the next day.  On November 6, 1982, the family dog returned to the cabin in good health. Mr. Christensen has never been located.

Case reference: 2013000109.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1996, Huguette Douville was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. She walks with an irregular gait, specifically a hunchback posture and always carries grocery bags. Huguette regularly hitchhikes.

Case reference: 2014003434.CaseDesc: On the evening of May 18, 1986, Monique Brosseau was seen for the last time at her home in Duhamel-Ouest, Quebec.

Case reference: 2013000059.CaseDesc: Normand Pellerin was last seen on July 4, 1999, at a fireworks show in the vicinity of the Jacques-Cartier Bridge in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005293.CaseDesc: On the morning of January 20, 1999, Abdol Hossein was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Scar: Cheek, Welts all over his face and cheek

Case reference: 2009003699.CaseDesc: Michel Gagich, who typically goes by his middle name: Steve, was last seen by his father on Saturday, September 5, 2009 at his residence in Hamilton.  He left his residence on Sunday, September 6, 2009 in the morning, around 8:00 a.m. without speaking to his parents.  He left a note indicating that he was leaving for the weekend. Mr. Gagich's vehicle was located on Tuesday, September 8, 2009 at approximately 7:15 p.m. when a passing airplane observed a fire.  By the time the fire department arrived the vehicle was completely burned.  The vehicle was located in a remote area on Emmett Lake Road in St. Edmund's Township.  Mr. Gagich was last seen at the Tobermory Ferry Terminal on Wednesday, September 9, 2009 at 7 a.m.  It is not known if he purchased a ticket to board the ferry.  The MS Chi Cheemaun ferry provides transportation for vehicles and people from Tobermory to South Baymouth on Manitoulin Island.

Hair: Brown, Short, Dark, receding hair line; Moustache, Sideburns

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2014004911.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1974, Ellice Harper, his wife and their young child were out on the lake duck hunting and fishing on Red Sucker Lake, Manitoba. At one point in the day, the party stopped on shore to eat. During this stop, they noticed a storm coming in. By the time they left there were already waves forming as they started out across the lake. The wind increased and the waves were so strong that they would almost cause the vessel to flip over. The boat filled with water and a wave took him out of the boat. His wife and child drifted in the boat until they reached shore and were later rescued. It is presumed Ellice drowned.

Case reference: 2020007826.CaseDesc: Gerhart Kiel was reported missing from his residence in Minburn, Alberta. His vehicle, a dark grey 2009 Ford Ranger which has a truck bed cover in the same colour, was also reported missing from his residence. Gerhart has not had any contact with his family since November 23, 2019.

Case reference: 2014002401.CaseDesc: Jane was a student at Laurentian University in Sudbury, Ontario. She was last seen on August 9, 1975, in her apartment just before she went to bed at 2:00 a.m. The next day she was not seen or heard from, and was reported missing. Her personal belongings were left behind. It appears that Jane may have been a victim of foul play.

Scar: Forehead, Small round scare between the eyebrows.

Case reference: 2020017914.CaseDesc: In January of 1983, Helen King was seen for the last time at the Woodbine Community Centre in Toronto, Ontario where she had been a volunteer. Helen is known for living a transient lifestyle and has had no contact with family or friends since this time.

Case reference: 2014005273.CaseDesc: Elaine Frieda Alook was last seen on May 11, 2004, on Tower road, outside of Fort McMurray, Alberta.

Scar: Lower Back, She had a cast from her wrist to elbow on her left arm

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Bérénice and Bérengère Paré were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Bérénice and Bérengère, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date, the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2018063463.CaseDesc: During the last week of November in 1992, Slavko Orasnin was seen for the last time by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005883.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1996, André Pellerin was seen for the last time in the Nouveau-Rosemont district in Montreal, Quebec. He left his residence in the morning to go to a shopping mall. André suffers from mental health issues and must take his medication every day. When he left his home, he had no medication with him.

Coat: Nylon, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Three-quarter length

Case reference: 2014006038.CaseDesc: Kimberley Cruickshank was reported missing on March 25, 2013. She was last seen on March 22, 2013 in her apartment on the 2400 Block of Abbott Road in Regina, SK.

Hair: Brown, Red, Straight, Hair is shaved around sides and back with medium length section on the top
Pierce: Ears, 3 piercings on the right side and 1 on the left

Case reference: 2012020019.CaseDesc: Emerson Dobroskay, was last seen on October 28, 1988 at the Pit Pub located at the University of British Columbia. It is believed that Emerson may have fallen into a large pit dug for construction, but all searches have failed to locate him. Although foul play is not suspected, it cannot be ruled out.

Case reference: 2022001740.CaseDesc: On December 26, 2021, Gonzalo Rubi last spoke with his family and friends. Gonzalo’s bank card was last used on December 28, and his abandoned vehicle was subsequently located in a neighbourhood in London, Ontario, on January 15, 2022.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Cuba across the fingers

Case reference: 2014001907.CaseDesc: Mary Rose Keadjuk was last seen between late June and August 1990 in Yellowknife, Northwest Territories, and was reported missing in September 1990. At the time of her disappearance, Mary Rose was residing at the Gold Range Hotel. In 2003, partial human remains were discovered in Yellowknife, and forensic DNA analysis determined that the remains were those of Mary Rose Keadjuk in 2018. The investigation into her disappearance  is still active and ongoing.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 1 tooth treated and 6 teeth absent.

Case reference: 2014004359.CaseDesc: On July 20, 2003, Stephane Gallant was last seen at the Shoreline Hotel in Thunder Bay, Ontario.  Stephane speaks French and English with a French accent.  Stephane worked in the logging industry as a woodcutter. On July 23, 2003, his vehicle, a 1984 GMC S10 blue pickup with a black topper, was located at the Trowbridge Falls campsite on Copenhagen Road in Thunder Bay, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004566.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1981, at approximately 5:00pm, Dennis Krioul was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Dennis’ wife states that he was in some business trouble and he had a warrant out for his arrest for fraud.

Case reference: 2020009419.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1989, at approximately 12:00pm, Jessica Sakouhi was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Jessica was visiting from France and was due to return back on August 19, but she did not board the plane.

Case reference: 2019017116.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2003, Anne-Marie Laforest was last seen by her family in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006077.CaseDesc: Schuyler Bierkos was last seen by his roommate at his home in Calgary, Alberta on February 24, 2013. The reason for his disapearance is unknown.

Hair: Blonde, Other, Usually has a beard
Scar: Head, severe acne and scars on face

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm, circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2006006399.CaseDesc: Gerald Joseph Bouchard was last seen on the morning of June 4, 1998, in the Town of Moosonee, Ontario. Moosonee is a remote Northern Ontario community situated on the coast of James Bay. There are no roads to Moosonee and access is by rail or aircraft. It is believed that Mr. Bouchard may have left Moosonee by jumping on a rail boxcar.

Case reference: 2016060399.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1975, the skeletal remains of a male were found in the brush on Sparrow Lake Road (Lot 23 Con 14) in Orillia. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5'8"-5'9" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  A pair of nail clippers was also found nearby. His death is estimated to have occurred in the spring or summer prior.

Teeth: No dental work, missing a few teeth in upper jaw.
Scarf: Orange, Knitted gold-coloured material, possibly a scarf or sweater
Shoes: Brown leather clog-type shoes with a raised Cuban heel, size 7-8
Tie: Red, white, and blue material with curved design - possibly a necktie or head band
Underwear: White, Undershirt with label, partial initials "MP" followed by "LAN", beneath these "PETTIN"

Case reference: 2018062802.CaseDesc: On August 27, 2000, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Yao Lin was seen for the last time at his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005317.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1996, Sabrina John was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sabrina’s parents had gotten into an argument that night, and the following day she and her mother had left their home with their clothing.

Case reference: 2020020791.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2020, David was supposed to cross into Tucson, Arizona from Nogales, Mexico. Unfortunately, he has not been heard from since. Last contact was made around midnight between May 12 and 13, 2020.

Case reference: 2020007968.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1977, Aurelio Ferreira was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Aurelio was despondent.

Case reference: 2022043376.CaseDesc: On August 17, 2022, Angela Alexis was seen for the last time by a family member as she was leaving a residence on the Alexis Nakota Sioux Nation in Alberta. A few days prior to her disappearance, Angela spent a few days socializing with family and friends.

Case reference: 2013000136.CaseDesc: Mr. Joseph Moore was last seen on October 31, 2012 by his employer in Kincardine, Ontario.  He was reported missing on November 12, 2012. Upon investigation, Joseph's apartment was found neat and tidy and his clothing and luggage had been left behind. Joseph is known to suffer from severe cases of depression. The last potential sighting was at the Kincardine Davidson Centre on November 8, 2012.  A media blitz was done to request feedback for missing person Joseph Moore with limited feedback. An extensive search of the area was conducted with negative results.

Case reference: 2014001506.CaseDesc: During the early morning hours of February 24, 1991, Harrison Brown left a friend's home on snowmobile and was last seen traveling near open water.

Hat: Plastic, Black, Snowmobile helmet with red and gold stripes
Scar: Left Upper Arm, Just above elbow

Case reference: 2018063020.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1997, Donghui Zhao was last heard from when he spoke with his friend in Toronto, Ontario. Donghui had not been seen or heard from for three months before his disappearance was reported.

Case reference: 2014002416.CaseDesc: On May 5, 1983, Desmond Runstedler was believed to be travelling to Ontario and was last seen standing on the side of Highway #13 near Lougheed, AB.  His personal items were left at his residence.

Case reference: 2016058794.CaseDesc: Raymond Raine was reported missing in 2016 after family members had not heard from him in several years. Raymond has ties to Maskwacis, Alberta, but was last known to be in the Fort Saskatchewan, Alberta area.

Scar: Left Forearm, 2 inch stab wound scar

Case reference: 2014002831.CaseDesc: On December 26, 1980, Zulfiqar Charania was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Zulfiqar lived in Ottawa but was at his sister’s home in Montreal to spend the holidays. When Zulfiqar left Montreal he did so without his suitcase, which was filled with his personal belongings. Zulfiqar had indicated that he intended on travelling to New York in the United States to visit another family member.

Case reference: 2014005240.CaseDesc: Morden Utinowatum was last seen on April 6, 2002 at 9:00pm in the area of Beaver Ranch, Alberta, near Fort Vermilion. Morden  wandered off from a residence after visiting family in the area.  Morden has not been seen or heard from since. Morden suffered from alcohol addiction problems.

Case reference: 2014000020.CaseDesc: Lorraine Roach was last seen at home at approximately 1:30 a.m. on May 11, 2013, by her husband. He indicated that she was upset over a family matter and was heading to the local casino. She left driving her vehicle, which was later found parked on the side of the road near a walking trail about 7 kilometers from her home. She never went to the casino that evening.

Pierce: Ears, both ears have 3 piercings with diamond studs

Case reference: 2012020073.CaseDesc: On February 20, 2004, at approximately 11:45 p.m., Sunshine Wood was seen for the last time in front of the St. Regis Hotel, situated on 285 Smith Street, in Winnipeg, Manitoba. That night, Sunshine had been socializing with a number of the hotel’s patrons in front of the hotel. During the time of her disappearance, Sunshine was enrolled at the Gordon Bell High School, and is not known to be a runaway. Her disappearance is out of character.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Image of a heart
Left Hand, Unknown tattoo on all fingers

Case reference: 2012020006.CaseDesc: Lucas James Degerness was last seen on June 7, 2007 in Prince George, British-Columbia. He spent that night with a friend.

Mark: Torso (Back), Brown in color, left side
Head, Dime size bald spot - front

Case reference: 2018053572.CaseDesc: On February 15, 1996, Maymuna Mohamid was seen for the last time by her brother and sister-in-law in Toronto, Ontario. When her brother returned home, Maymuna and all her personal belongings were gone.

Case reference: 2006012299.CaseDesc: On June 02, 1984, Andrew Grinnell, his brother,their cousin and a friend  departed Sioux Lookout on a canoe trip on the Albany River. The party arrived in Fort Albany on July 18, 1984. At 6:00 p.m. that same day, the party decided to leave Fort Albany in an attempt to paddle to Moosonee via James Bay. The group had planned to go out onto James Bay with the tide and sail to Moosonee by lashing their canoes together. An intense storm engulfed the James Bay coastal area on July 23, 1984, and it is likely that the party perished on the Bay during this storm. Three victims were recovered in August 1984, twelve nautical miles North of the Moose River. Mr. Grinnell's body has never been recovered.
